text: "U-Haul" is a song by American recording artist Angie Stone. It was written and produced by Missy Elliott, Nisan Stewart, Craig Brockman, and John "Jubu" Smith for Stone's third studio album Stone Love (2004). Apart from Elliott, singers Tweet and Betty Wright as well as Stone's daughter Diamond appear as backing vocalists on the song. Released as the album's second single, it reached number 19 on Billboards Adult R&B; Songs. "U-Haul" was nominated for a Grammy Award for Best Female R&B; Vocal Performance at the 47th Grammy Awards. ==Track listings== ==Personnel== * Marcella Araica – recording assistance * Carlos Bedoya – recording * Craig Brockman – co-production, writing * Tim Donovan – recording * Missy Elliott – banking vocals, production, writing * Paul Falcone – mixing * John "Jubu" Smith – co-production, writing * Nisan Stewart – co-production, writing * Angie Stone – vocals, backing vocals * Diamond Stone – backing vocals * Tweet – backing vocals * Betty Wright – backing vocals ==Charts== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" ! scope="col"|Chart (2004) ! scope="col"|Peak position |- |} == References == ==External links== * Category:2004 songs Category:2004 singles Category:Songs written by Missy Elliott Category:J Records singles Category:Angie Stone songs Category:Songs written by Nisan Stewart Category:Songs written by Craig Brockman
title: U-Haul (song)
